inputs:
Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh great, another meeting. Just what I needed today. (b) Oh great, another meeting. I can't wait to sit through it.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Wow, I'm so glad I spent all that money on a degree that I'm not even using. (b) Wow, I'm so glad I spent all that money on a degree that's really paying off.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love sitting in traffic for hours. It's the highlight of my day. (b) I just love sitting in traffic for hours. It's so relaxing.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh sure, let's just keep ignoring the elephant in the room. That always works out well. (b) Oh sure, let's just keep ignoring the elephant in the room. That's a great idea.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love it when people talk loudly on their phones in public places. It's so considerate. (b) I just love it when people talk loudly on their phones in public places. It's so peaceful.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh great, another email from my boss. Just what I needed today. (b) Oh great, another email from my boss. I can't wait to read it.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh sure, let me just drop everything and work on your problem. (b) Oh sure, I have nothing better to do than work on your problem.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Yeah, because everyone loves being stuck in traffic for hours. (b) Yeah, because everyone loves a quick and easy commute.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh great, another meeting that could have been an email. (b) Oh great, another email that could have been a meeting.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Wow, I love spending all my money on textbooks. (b) Wow, I love saving money by not buying textbooks.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh yeah, because waking up at 5am is so easy. (b) Oh yeah, because sleeping in until noon is so productive.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh sure, let me just put my life on hold to help you. (b) Oh sure, let me just ignore my own responsibilities to help you.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh, I just love getting stuck in the rain without an umbrella. It's my favorite thing. (b) Oh, I just love getting stuck in the rain without an umbrella. It's so refreshing.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Wow, I can't wait to spend my entire weekend cleaning the house. (b) Wow, I can't wait to spend my entire weekend binge-watching Netflix.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh great, another assignment due tomorrow. Just what I needed. (b) Oh great, another assignment due tomorrow. I'm so excited to work on it.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love waking up early on weekends. It's the best feeling. (b) I just love waking up early on weekends. It's so peaceful.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh, I just love being stuck in a crowded elevator with strangers. It's my favorite thing. (b) Oh, I just love being stuck in a crowded elevator with strangers. It's so much fun.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love spending hours on hold with customer service. It's the highlight of my day. (b) I just love spending hours on hold with customer service. It's so informative.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh great, another meeting to discuss the agenda for the meeting (b) Oh great, another meeting to discuss the budget for the year
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love sitting in traffic for hours on end (b) I just love getting to my destination quickly and easily
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I can't wait to spend all day cleaning the house (b) I can't wait to spend all day lounging on the couch
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) This is just what I wanted, a broken phone (b) This is just what I wanted, a brand new phone
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I'm so glad it's raining again (b) I'm so glad it's sunny and warm outside
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love being stuck in an elevator with strangers (b) I just love having my own private elevator
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love getting stuck in traffic. It's the best part of my day. (b) I just love getting stuck in traffic. It's so much fun.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh great, another meeting. Just what I needed. (b) Oh great, another meeting. I can hardly wait.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Oh, I just love it when my phone dies in the middle of an important call. (b) Oh, I just love it when my phone stays charged during an important call.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I'm so glad I spent all that money on a gym membership and never went. (b) I'm so glad I spent all that money on a gym membership and actually used it every day.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love it when it rains on my day off. (b) I just love it when it's sunny on my day off.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I'm so excited to spend my entire weekend doing laundry. (b) I'm so excited to spend my entire weekend relaxing and having fun.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I just love it when my computer crashes right before I save my work. (b) I just love it when my computer works perfectly and never crashes.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I'm so glad I woke up late and missed my flight. (b) I'm so glad I woke up early and made it to my flight with plenty of time to spare.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I love spending hours on hold with customer service. It's such a fun way to pass the time. (b) I love spending hours on hold with customer service. It's so efficient and helpful.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) Wow, this traffic jam is just what I needed to start my day off right. (b) Wow, this traffic jam is really helping me get to work on time.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) I'm so glad I forgot my umbrella on this rainy day. It's such a refreshing change of pace. (b) I'm so glad I brought my umbrella on this rainy day. It's really helping me stay dry.
A:

Q: Which statement is sarcastic? (a) This line at the DMV is moving so fast! (b) This line at the DMV is taking forever!
A:
